articles.headline: As the Euro Slides, a Coin Meets Its Waterloo
articles.snippet: A commemorative coin minted by Belgium raised hackles in France, a small example of the continuing bumps on the road to European unity.
articles.abstract: A commemorative coin minted by Belgium raised hackles in France, a small example of the continuing bumps on the road to European unity.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — Here at the Belgian Royal Mint, machines called giraffes spit out as many as 850 euros a minute.

articles.headline: Police Rethink Long Tradition on Using Force
articles.snippet: A small but vocal number of law enforcement officials are calling for a rethinking of axioms that have emphasized how to use force, not how to avoid it.
articles.abstract: A small but vocal number of law enforcement officials are calling for a rethinking of axioms that have emphasized how to use force, not how to avoid it.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — During a training course on defending against knife attacks, a young Salt Lake City police officer asked a question: “How close can somebody get to me before I’m justified in using deadly force?”

articles.headline: Nepal’s Young Men, Lost to Migration, Then a Quake
articles.snippet: Healthy young men were leaving to find work in great waves before the quake. Now, even before the dead are fully counted, it is clear that Nepal cannot afford the losses.
articles.abstract: Healthy young men were leaving to find work in great waves before the quake. Now, even before the dead are fully counted, it is clear that Nepal cannot afford the losses.
articles.lead_paragraph: KATHMANDU, Nepal — When the dense pillar of smoke from cremations by the Bagmati River was thinning late last week, the bodies were all coming from Gongabu, a common stopover for Nepali migrant workers headed overseas, and they were all of young men.

articles.headline: With Boxing Match, Video Piracy Battle Enters Latest Round: Mobile Apps
articles.snippet: With the Mayweather-Pacquiao bout, live streaming from mobile apps was just one of the new piracy headaches facing media companies.
articles.abstract: With the Mayweather-Pacquiao bout, live streaming from mobile apps was just one of the new piracy headaches facing media companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: The method used by thousands of people to watch unauthorized broadcasts of Saturday night’s big boxing match might have been new, but to longtime media executives, who have led one battle against piracy after another, it was the same old story.
articles.byline: By Nick Wingfield and Emily Steel

articles.headline: Berkshire’s Warren Buffett Shows His Teddy Bear Image Has Tough Side
articles.snippet: Mr. Buffett, chief of Berkshire Hathaway, responded to concern that he had abandoned his company’s moral compass by teaming with 3G, an investment firm known for ruthlessly cutting jobs.
articles.abstract: Mr. Buffett, chief of Berkshire Hathaway, responded to concern that he had abandoned his company’s moral compass by teaming with 3G, an investment firm known for ruthlessly cutting jobs.
articles.lead_paragraph: OMAHA — “I don’t know of any company that has a policy that says, ‘We’re going to have a lot more people than we need.’ ”

articles.headline: For Top 25 Hedge Fund Managers, a Difficult 2014 Still Paid Well
articles.snippet: Most hedge funds were poor performers in 2014; only half of the top 10 earners beat the S.&P. 500 — yet the top 25 earned $11.62 billion.
articles.abstract: Most hedge funds were poor performers in 2014; only half of the top 10 earners beat the S.&P. 500 — yet the top 25 earned $11.62 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: For investors in hedge funds, like big pension funds, 2014 was not a lucrative year. But for those who managed their money, the pay was spectacular.

articles.headline: Rural Indiana Struggles to Contend With H.I.V. Outbreak
articles.snippet: More than 140 people in Austin, Ind. — population 4,200 — and its environs have tested positive for H.I.V., but fear and misinformation are hampering efforts to contain the outbreak.
articles.abstract: More than 140 people in Austin, Ind. — population 4,200 — and its environs have tested positive for H.I.V., but fear and misinformation are hampering efforts to contain the outbreak.
articles.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Ind. — She became addicted to painkillers over a decade ago, when a car wreck left her with a broken back and doctors prescribed OxyContin during her recovery. Then came a new prescription opiate, Opana, easily obtained on the street and more potent when crushed, dissolved in water and injected. She did just that, many times a day, sometimes sharing needles with other addicts.

articles.headline: Lawmakers in France Move to Vastly Expand Surveillance
articles.snippet: A measure would give the intelligence services the right to gather potentially unlimited electronic data from Internet communications, and to tap cellphones and capture text messages.
articles.abstract: A measure would give the intelligence services the right to gather potentially unlimited electronic data from Internet communications, and to tap cellphones and capture text messages.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — At a moment when American lawmakers are reconsidering the broad surveillance powers assumed by the government after Sept. 11, the lower house of the French Parliament took a long stride in the opposite direction Tuesday, overwhelmingly approving a bill that could give the authorities their most intrusive domestic spying abilities ever, with almost no judicial oversight.
